name: Slow Cooker Butter Chicken
author: The Meal Planner
summary: Indian food is one of my favorites, so when my friend made this slow cooker version for my family we were head over heels!  I don't think I've had a Butter Chicken that I've liked more.  It's wonderful to put into the slow cooker in the morning and come home to the warm Indian spice smell....LOVE IT! Serve with basmati rice and warm naan bread.
ingredients: 4 large skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Melt the butter and vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Stir in the chicken, onion, and garlic
Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 10 minutes
Stir in the curry powder, curry paste, tandoori masala, garam masala, and tomato paste until no lumps of tomato paste remain
Pour into a slow cooker, and stir in the cardamom pods, coconut milk, and yogurt
Cook on High 4 to 6 hours, or on Low 6 to 8 hours until the chicken is tender and the sauce has reduced to your desired consistency
Remove and discard the cardamom pods before serving
